titleStmt.title: Love and honour: or, The lovers farevvel to Calista Being sent from sea in the late engagement against the Dutch, to his mistris, under the name of Calista. With the ladies deploring and ingenious answer. To a sad new air much in request; or, tune of, Now the tyrant hath stolen.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Goldenball, in West-smithfield, neer the Hospital-gate,

notesStmt.note: Imprint place and publication date from Wing.
Verse - "Farewel my Calista my joy and my grief,".
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.

place.placeName: the Goldenball, in West-smithfield, neer the Hospital-gate
